intro: Cirrhopetalum treschii, commonly known as the Cape York hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and red. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. It has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its structure is often shrub-like. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and ecological significance in its native habitat.
